titleStmt.title: Jesse Rice et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8703

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: To His Excellency J. F. Robinson, Governor of Kentucky,

We the undersigned petitioners would respectfully represent, to Your excellency that at the August Term 1862 of the Hancock Circuit Court one John Egloff a German. was Indicted by the Grand Jury in three several. cases two of which Indictments were for selling Spirits to Negroes, and one for selling to a minor. -- They state that by an arrangement that made between Mr Egloff & the attorney for the Commonwealth that a Judgment was entered in one of the Cases agst him for $50. & $10 in each of the other cases. --

They would respectfully state to Your excellency that Mr Egloff is a verry old man and a large family dependent upon him for a support and he is verry poor. -- and without a home & has to depend upon his own exertions for a support for himself and family and that it would be a great hardship to enforce the Collections of sd Judgment upon him that he is not familliar with the laws & usages of the Country -- -- They would threfore respectfully request humbly pray your excellency to remit said fine against sd Egloff & they will ever pray &c

Jesse Rice
Eldred.E. Fale, Clerk
Ben. F. Miller
Eli H Brown
Edward Humphreys
George W. Wheatley
Abram Brown
Thomas J Ross
Giles Chambers
John Johnson
J W Wilson
Ed. V. Marble,

john Riches

John McBrown Presiding Judge
The fine for Fifty dollars remitted the other two not remitted

$50. } liquor to a minor
John Egloff
Issd Feby 16. 1863
